Sometimes simpler is better. I like that thereâ€™s not a lot of unnecessary graphics and animations that most word games have these days. Itâ€™s a pretty good mix of challenging and easier words.  Overall I have three issues that, if improved, would raise my rating. 

1: I canâ€™t see how many hints Iâ€™ve used before I lose a point for asking. I usually go several words before needing a hint and it would be nice to see a countdown so I could make an educated decision about using it or just skipping the word. 

2: If I skip a word, it doesnâ€™t tell me what the correct answer is. Seems like a simple improvement that could help users learn something new and get better at the game.

3: The tile font needs to change. I had the word â€œIllinoisâ€ and I couldnâ€™t tell the difference between an uppercase â€œiâ€ and a lowercase â€œL.â€ I lost two points guessing the wrong letter. 

These all seem like pretty simple fixes that would make the game more enjoyable.

I wish to express my dissatisfaction and disappointment with the experience I encountered with this application. Despite the initial impression that there was a free lifetime option available, I found myself in a situation where I was unexpectedly charged $21.38 for what was supposed to be a complimentary lifetime subscription. This experience left me feeling scammed and has raised concerns about the app's transparency and business practices. I strongly advise against downloading this app if you want to avoid similar financial pitfalls. It is crucial for businesses to uphold transparency and fairness in their pricing structures to ensure a positive user experience.

App Review: A Deceptive Experience

I recently downloaded an app that was featured on the â€œApps Gone Freeâ€ platform, promising a 24-hour promotional offer for lifetime access at no cost. Enticed by the offer, I installed the app and proceeded through the setup process. However, upon reaching the final step to redeem the free lifetime access, I encountered a significant issue: a banner obscured the submit button, rendering it unclickable. This obstruction prevented me from completing the redemption process. ï¿¼ ï¿¼

Subsequently, I discovered that instead of receiving the promised free lifetime access, I was enrolled in a yearly subscription costing $14.99. This unexpected charge felt deceptive and manipulative. The developersâ€™ decision to obscure the redemption button suggests a deliberate attempt to funnel users into a paid subscription under the guise of a free offer. ï¿¼

In response to this experience, I have removed my payment information from my iTunes Apple ID to prevent any further unauthorized charges. This incident has left me feeling frustrated and disillusioned, as I have never encountered such tactics with any other app.

I strongly advise potential users to exercise caution before downloading this app. The developers appear to prioritize their financial gain over user trust and transparency. Such practices undermine the integrity of promotional offers and erode user confidence.

The concept is great, the app is eloquent. However, the description offers minimal insight. 

It does not photograph when you unlock your phone, it photographs when you open this app. So you must leave it in the foreground when you lock your phone for it to work. 

Additionally, there is a delay, and I tested it; if you swipe out of the app before it manages to capture, you bypass the photograph and nothing is recorded. 

Also, the passcode sound alert is when THIS appâ€™s custom entry passcode is typed wrong - not when your phoneâ€™s lock screen passcode is typed wrong.

There are no instructions for use to make sure Iâ€™m not missing anything, and very few customization features to toy with. Iâ€™m sure that actually capturing a photo upon unlock by a third party app does not fall within the security parameters by Apple. However, I believe there could still be some creative workarounds to eloquently trigger a log more quickly and efficiently without being too intrusive. 

I would love to see two things; an iCloud sync so I can check the log from another device in case it is stolen, as well as an improvement in the activity log UI. I have to click the trash can to delete one photo at a time, and type my passcode each time. Why is there no select box or â€˜select allâ€™ button?
